title: The Middle East's autocrats make peace
description: The Arab League summit, held on May 19 in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, with Bashar al-Assad in attendance for the first time in 12 years, highlights the project of regional restructuring led by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Biden backs advanced fighter jets, pilot training for Ukraine
description: The US move signals a major breakthrough for Kyiv in its efforts to fend off the Russian invasion.

title: Tim Scott is making a bid to become first Black Republican US president
description: The South Carolina senator plans to launch his campaign in North Charleston on Monday, and joins the ranks of those hoping to steer the party away from Trump.

title: 'Killers of the Flower Moon' by Scorsese to premiere at Cannes Film Festival
description: The American filmmaker was not featured in the film festival's official selection since 'After Hours,' in 1986.

title: United States: Low flow of Colorado River reshuffles water allocation
description: The flow of the great American West river has decreased by 20% in 100 years. If the crossed states do not agree to review water allocation laws, the federal government will have to take drastic action.

title: What would Ukraine do with F-16s?
description: Ukraine has been calling on its Western allies for months to provide F-16 jet fighters. Despite fears of escalation, an agreement on their delivery looks closer than ever. It remains to be seen whether those fighters can really make a difference.

title: In Gaza, the Palestinian Islamic Jihad is on the front line
description: The movement has confronted Israel with rockets since the beginning of May, a battle that has won it immense popularity. Spurring insurgency in the West Bank, it has come to embody Palestinian resistance.

title: Three generations in Vietnam's historic Cholon neighborhood embrace their Chinese heritage
description: From the grandfather who was born in the era of French colonization in 1949, to the 24-year-old grandson now running the family business, the Zhao family encapsulates the layered history of the Chinatown nestled next to what was once called Saigon.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia intensifies air strike campaign on Kyiv
description: Various types of missiles and drones are being used by Russia to try to hit targets across the country. Ukraine claims that its anti-aircraft defenses, far from being undermined, have successfully neutralized Russian Kinzhal hypersonic missiles.

title: Stellantis threatens to close UK factories if Brexit is not renegotiated
description: The transition to electric vehicles combined with the enactment of new clauses related to Brexit is weakening the British automotive industry.

title: Volkswagen exits Russia following sale of local assets
description: The sale includes the German group's flagship factory in Kaluga, southwest of Moscow, which employs around 4,000 and delivers 225,000 vehicles annually.

title: Cannes 2023: 'Black Flies' portrays Sean Penn as paramedic pawn in New York
description: Impersonating the John Wayne of emergency services, the actor drives an ambulance at full speed in an tiresome film directed by Jean-Stéphane Sauvaire.

title: Disney fires back at DeSantis, cancels plans for $1 billion campus
description: Democrats blame the Florida governor for waging a culture war against Disney. Former president Donald Trump was quick to mock his Republican rival.

title: Cannes 2023: 'Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny,' Harrison Ford's search of lost time
description: The fifth movie was presented at a world premiere on Thursday at the Cannes Film Festival, although out of the competition. The 80-year-old actor received an honorary Palme d'Or.

title: Who is Julie Chavez Rodriguez, Joe Biden's campaign manager?
description: The granddaughter of the great American labor leader Cesar Chavez has been named Joe Biden's campaign manager for the 2024 US presidential election. She will have to rally Hispanic voters in particular.

title: The French military's cautious steps toward robotic combat
description: After falling behind in the field of armed aerial drones, the Army wants to speed up the deployment of remotely operated munitions and ground robots. But the technical and ethical challenges remain numerous.

title: Andy Rourke, The Smiths' bassist, has died
description: The 'supremely gifted' bass guitarist whose 'dazzling basslines' defined an era of British indie music passed away after a long struggle with pancreatic cancer. He was 59 years old.

title: Hiroshima, as G7 host, wants calls for peace and nuclear arms abolition to be heard
description: The Japanese city wants to keep the memory of the 1945 atomic bombing alive, and will convey a message about a total ban on nuclear weapons during the summit from May 19 to 21.

title: Ukraine's Zelensky to attend Hiroshima G7 summit
description: The recent visit adds more pressure on Russia, set against the haunting history of a city known for the devastation of nuclear warfare.

title: G7 allies announce new sanctions against Russia's 'war machine' targeting diamond trade
description: Leaders of the world's most powerful democracies devoted much of the first full day of the Group of Seven summit to finding new ways to punish Russia for its 15-month invasion of Ukraine.

title: Around Europe, movie theaters are on the rebound
description: In Germany, France and the United Kingdom, audiences have returned to theaters, thanks in particular to young people. Film production has also returned to its pre-Covid level.

title: Macron renews ties with prominent economists to discuss next steps
description: In search of a rebound, President Emmanuel Macron held meetings with the economists who inspired his 2017 policy platform, including Jean Pisani-Ferry and Philippe Aghion. Some had distanced themselves during the pension reform.

title: In Jerusalem, Israeli nationalists participate in flag-waving march amidst heightened tensions
description: Thousands of Jewish nationalists, some of them chanting anti-arab slogans, participated in the annual tradition that caused new friction between Jews and Palestinians in the tense city.

title: Ecuador signs deal exchanging debt relief for conversation of the Galapagos
description: The small South American country's innovative 'debt-for-nature' deal will see its debt reduced in return for funding measures to protect the biodiversity of the archipelago, which is classified as a World Heritage Site.

title: Twitter accuses Microsoft of improperly using its data
description: Twitter has accused Microsoft of 'abusive usage' of its data, which was free and accessible prior to Elon Musk taking over.

title: 'The Kerala Story': A controversial film accused of fueling Hindu nationalist propaganda
description: The fiction film, which tells the story of three female students manipulated by Muslim men into joining the IS, is presented as a documentary and raises questions about the increasingly blurred lines between cinema and propaganda.

title: 'If Kemal Kiliçdaroglu were elected, a multi-faceted dialogue between Europe and Turkey could resume'
description: In his article for 'Le Monde,' former EU ambassador to Turkey Marc Pierini examines the implications of a Kiliçdaroglu presidency on Turkey's relationship with NATO and Russia.
